note.p: Education: School at Wem, Shropshire; Trinity College, Cambridge; BA (1723), MA (1726), BD (1736), DD (1749); Incorporated at Oxford (1731)
Career: Fellow of Trinity (1725); Professor of Geology (1734-1762); Ordained deacon (1733); Vicar of Barrington, Cambridgeshire (1742); Rector of Orwell (1762-1771)
HW Robinson ,'A note on Charles Mason's ancestry and his family' in Proceedings of the American Philosophical Society, Vol. 93, No. 2, 1949
TD Cope, 'Collecting source material about Charles Mason and Jeremiah Dixon' in Proceedings of the American Philosophical Society, Vol. 92,(2) 1948, pp111-114.
